hi @xwjiang-ms if the update gets into failure, should we expect the apt install works? Do we get a chance to look into the details of the failure of update, transient network issue? I'm ok to have this PR, should we concern the update failure and surface it at early stage?

> hi @xwjiang-ms if the update gets into failure, should we expect the apt install works? Do we get a chance to look into the details of the failure of update, transient network issue? I'm ok to have this PR, should we concern the update failure and surface it at early stage?

Sometimes it's caused by transient azure agent issue, and this step will only install jq and parse info, we will do update with retry in following steps

Hi @ZhaohuiS, is this PR to move skipped tests from excluded list in pipeline setting to `test_mark_conditional.yml`? If that's the case, I would suggest using some other skip condition instead of github issue because we have a plan to cleanup skipped test because of test issue.

> Hi @ZhaohuiS, is this PR to move skipped tests from excluded list in pipeline setting to `test_mark_conditional.yml`? If that's the case, I would suggest using some other skip condition instead of github issue because we have a plan to cleanup skipped test because of test issue.

Hi @bingwang-ms currently, those 4 scripts are running on Arista platforms, I am not sure if we have to skip it or need to address those failures to make them pass, so add a github issue(test gap) to skip them temporarily. If you can confirm that they are indeed to be skipped, then I am fine to use other skip condition to do that. That's why it needs feature owner to review it and give us some feedback how to handle them correctly.

@shitalpatil148 could you help to clarify how it passed before if it would fail with PR testing on KVM?

> @shitalpatil148 could you help to clarify how it passed before if it would fail with PR testing on KVM?

This passed previously because it was executed on physical testbeds.

PR testing runs on VS/KVM, where ASIC and counters DB are not present, so CRM threshold validation is not applicable and may fail.

Skipping verify_thresholds() only when asic_type == "vs" prevents false PR failures, while full CRM validation continues to run on physical platforms.

> > @shitalpatil148 could you help to clarify how it passed before if it would fail with PR testing on KVM?
> 
> This passed previously because it was executed on physical testbeds.
> 
> PR testing runs on VS/KVM, where ASIC and counters DB are not present, so CRM threshold validation is not applicable and may fail.
> 
> Skipping verify_thresholds() only when asic_type == "vs" prevents false PR failures, while full CRM validation continues to run on physical platforms.

I see, if that's the case, should we skip this test for PR? @shitalpatil148 @xwjiang-ms

> > > @shitalpatil148 could you help to clarify how it passed before if it would fail with PR testing on KVM?
> > 
> > 
> > This passed previously because it was executed on physical testbeds.
> > PR testing runs on VS/KVM, where ASIC and counters DB are not present, so CRM threshold validation is not applicable and may fail.
> > Skipping verify_thresholds() only when asic_type == "vs" prevents false PR failures, while full CRM validation continues to run on physical platforms.
> 
> I see, if that's the case, should we skip this test for PR? @shitalpatil148 @xwjiang-ms

@StormLiangMS I think we can keep it for some configuration check but skip the asic validation

can we have this PR to target add one or more clusters (t1 ports) for exisiting running line cards (with non-empty ports) in the buildout scenario. For other additional test cases, raise separate PRs .

> can we have this PR to target add one or more clusters (t1 ports) for exisiting running line cards or pizza box t2 (with non-empty ports) in the buildout scenario. For other additional test cases, raise separate PRs .

> > can we have this PR to target add one or more clusters (t1 ports) for exisiting running line cards or pizza box (with non-empty ports) in the buildout scenario. For other additional test cases, raise separate PRs .
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

A few comments based on our discussion today:
1. Need to add a test case for production scenarios to bring up a new LC with basic config like iBGP etc and default front end port config in admin down. Then use 'add' operation to bringup interfaces on the Line Card
2. Add tests to bringup lines on an LC with existing lines in service. Only add operation should be used to add new ports in service. An option could be to use a dummy minigraph to configurure few ports and rest of the ports could be configured using GCU with add only operation.

Hi @abdosi , please add if I missed any. Thanks

For qos config, GCU test cases test "BUFFER_PG" and "PORT_QOS_MAP", no test on "QUEUE" and "BUFFER_QUEUE".
1, Need to verify "QUEUE" and "BUFFER_QUEUE" in config db after add cluster.
2, "QUEUE" and "BUFFER_QUEUE" is allegedly pre-populated for all ports and all queues, is there some particular action to make this happen?

After discussing the add cluster test case (to add configuration on a card with no previous cluster config), we have identified two options:

### Option 1

Create a custom minigraph via a functional test case:

- Remove the links of downstream LC and load this custom minigraph.
- The resulting config will not include cluster config, so we can test the operation via add.
- Revert to the original config by loading the original minigraph file.

### Status:

- Manually tested in Nokia lab.
- Requires additional automation effort (a few more days).

Minigraph changes required:

```
<CpgDec><PeeringSessions><BGPSession>
<CpgDec><Routers><a:BGPRouterDeclaration>
<DpgDec><DeviceDataPlaneInfo><PortChannelInterfaces><PortChannel>
<DpgDec><DeviceDataPlaneInfo><IPInterfaces><IPInterface>
<DpgDec><DeviceDataPlaneInfo><AclInterfaces><AclInterface>
<PngDec><DeviceInterfaceLinks><DeviceLinkBase>
<PngDec><Devices><Device i:type="LeafRouter">
```

### Option 2

Remove all cluster information in CONFIG_DB and save the configuration:

- Reboot the switch so it initializes with the saved configuration (without cluster config).

Hi,

@reviewers Kindly asking for re-reviewing PR w.r.t. latest commit changes.

**Summary of Changes**

This commit introduces two types of changes/addresses following issues found:

1. Remove Cluster in max-topos

The operation for removing cluster information via GCU for max-topos was taking a long time to execute (e.g., an ASIC namespace with 18 ports required ~30 minutes).
The latest commit optimizes this by checking the number of active interfaces. For max-topos, the configuration is now removed using sonic-db-cli commands instead of GCU.
For min-topos, GCU continues to be used.
(A new Issue to be created to further investigate the delay in GCU-based removal.)

2. Unexpected ERR logs for ACL_TABLE/PORTCHANNEL in success apply-patch

After enabling loganalyzer in the latest commit, unexpected ERR logs appeared in syslog related to operations on ACL_TABLE and PORTCHANNEL tables. Although the apply-patch operation succeeds, these ERR logs are triggered by libyang validation.
New Issues have been created to track this behavior: [#24295](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/issues/24295) and [#24338](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/issues/24338).
As a workaround, the cluster addition process has been split into two separate operations:
- Add PORTCHANNEL information.
- Add the remaining cluster information.

Thanks,
Olympia

Kindly asking for re-review after latest code fixes.

Please find summarized the types of fixes in latest commit:

- Implement two-phase apply-patch for cluster removal/add to work around below sonic-buildimage issues :
 - Normalize ACL_TABLE handling to remove/add entire table nodes instead of only ports (#24295).
 - Split localhost PORTCHANNEL adds/removes to separate operations and ensure proper ordering (#24338).
- Fix INTERFACE key handling: separate ip-prefix keys and interface names, apply alias mapping correctly and escape "/" with "~1".
- Add logging and temporarily disable loganalyzer around cluster removal.
- Update apply_patch_remove_cluster signature to accept cli_namespace_prefix and update call sites accordingly.
- Remove obsolete BUFFER_PG post-remove check.

Thanks,
Olympia
